clinical_study.brief_title: Development and Validation of a Multidimensional Score to Predict Long-term Kidney Transplant Outcomes
clinical_study.official_title: Multicenter International Observational Study to Build and Validate Multidimensional Risk Score in the Clinical Setting of Kidney Allograft Biopsies to Predict Long-term Allograft Survival

lead_sponsor.agency: Paris Translational Research Center for Organ Transplantation

clinical_study.source: Paris Translational Research Center for Organ Transplantation

detailed_description.textblock:
Background The field of kidney transplantation currently lacks robust models to predict long-term allograft failure, which represents a major unmet need in clinical care and clinical trials. This study aims to generate and validate an accessible scoring system that predicts individual patients' risk of long-term kidney allograft failure.
Main Outcome(s) and Measure(s)
A score based on classical statistical approaches to model determinants of allograft and patient survival (Cox model, multinomial regression). These models will be further completed with statistical approaches derived from artificial intelligence and machine learning.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Allograft survival probability at 7 year post transplantation
primary_outcome.description: Allograft survival probability, calculated from a composite score (based on clinical, histological, immunological, and functional variables) assessed at the time of biopsy.

intervention.description: Kidney recipients aged over 18 and of all sexes recruited from 2002 in European and North American centers, who have eGFR follow-up and data from protocol and for cause biopsies available for allograft survival assessment; RCT conducted over the past 20 years with available data on protocol biopsy within the first year and follow up clinical, biological and histological data.

study_pop.textblock: Kidney recipients aged over 18 and of all sexes recruited from 2002 in European and North American centers, who have eGFR follow-up and data from protocol and for cause biopsies for allograft survival assessment as well as RCTs with longitudinal data including baseline and follow-up clinical, functional, immunological and histological data.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Kidney recipient transplanted after 2002
- Kidney recipient over 18 years of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Combined transplantation
